title: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey Finds Buyer for Los Angeles House in Less Than Three Weeks
text:
An airy $4.495 million concrete house in Los Angeles tied to Twitter and Square CEO Jack Dorsey found a buyer in little more than two weeks.



The contemporary Hollywood Hills mansion, recently built on a side street off the celebrity-speckled Mulholland Drive, was only listed for sale in mid-August with The Agency’s Ben Belack and went into contract on Tuesday, according to the multiple listing service.



The Agency declined to comment on the deal.



More: Hong Kong Unrest Has High Net Worth Seeking Safer Havens Globally

But it’s not a total surprise that the house found a buyer so quickly.

Award-winning architecture firm AND Studio designed the nearly 4,000-square-foot glass-lined pile, completed in 2018, according to the listing.



The main living room and kitchen were built on the second level and open out onto a vast outdoor terrace with steps down to the pool and deck below. The second floor also encompasses the master suite, which has its own balcony overlooking the pool and views over Los Angeles, images of the home show.



The first floor houses another four bedrooms, plus a more intimate family room.



Mr. Dorsey, 42, primarily lives in San Francisco, where he owns a two-parcel, $30 million-plus spread built on a cliffside overlooking the Golden Gate Bridge, Mansion Global has reported.



From Penta: A Lamborghini Veneno Could Fetch US$6.3 Million at Bonhams

The entity that manages those San Francisco properties purchased the Hollywood Hills home a little more than a year ago, paying $4.225 million, according to property records. Mr. Dorsey could not immediately be reached for comment.



It’s not clear if the tech mogul ever used the home as his own. For a time, his friend, model Raven Lyn Corneil, stayed in the house, from which she posted numerous photos on her Instagram account over the past year. Ms. Corneil could not be reached for comment.
